channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat -- Red Hat Satellite
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat -- Red Hat Satellite

item.title: CVE-2017-7513|2024-08-05T16:04:11.809Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20satellite
item.description: It was found that Satellite 5 configured with SSL/TLS for the PostgreSQL backend failed to correctly validate X.509 server certificate host name fields. A man-in-the-middle attacker could use this flaw to spoof a PostgreSQL server using a specially crafted X.509 certificate.

item.title: CVE-2017-7514|2024-08-05T16:04:11.837Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20satellite
item.description: A cross-site scripting (XSS) flaw was found in how the failed action entry is processed in Red Hat Satellite before version 5.8.0. A user able to specify a failed action could exploit this flaw to perform XSS attacks against other Satellite users.
